title: Graphic Designer for Print Guidebooks
description: We are Dirty Freehub, a non-profit organization providing resources to gravel cyclists. In the ten years weve been in existence, our resources have been provided exclusively online. We are now expanding into the world of print, and were seeking a Graphic Designer to assist us in bringing our vision to fruition.We are creating a series of guidebooks, each which will contain a collection of bicycle maps as well as other content. Though each guidebook will have a separate theme, we would like for the entire series to have a similar look & feel. Each book will be printed in color, be approximately 64 pages in length, and measure roughly 4” x 5.375”. In addition to providing a plethora of excellent content, we want for our books to be visually attractive.We are seeking a Graphic Designer who: can help us refine our mock-ups into an attractive and well thought-out design template that we can use for all of our guidebooks. is well-versed in visual layout and print design. works comfortably on both the big picture and the tiny details. has a creative approach to tackling design challenges. is willing to work collaboratively with our team using Canva. works efficiently and has stellar communication skills. If it makes mutual sense, wed love to have the Graphic Designer assist with the project over the next few years as we publish additional books in our series.

title: UI Designer
description: ZIK Seeks a Lead UI DesignerZIK is crafting an innovative app to streamline a critical aspect of our daily routines.Were in search of exceptional individuals who are leaders in their fields, have a stellar track record, and thrive in a team environment. If that sounds like you, join ZIK - Be Part of Something Big.Were currently seeking a Lead UI Designer.Do you have an eye for pixel-perfect design? Obsessed with detail? Passionate about meticulous UI and intuitive UX? We value that deeply. This role goes beyond having extensive UI design skills; its about a profound dedication to crafting user interfaces that seamlessly blend aesthetics with user experience.As a UI Designer with us, youll:- Engage in our rigorous design process, shaping every aspect of our app across mobile, desktop, and web.- Develop and define our design language.What you need:- A portfolio featuring renowned and/or exceptionally designed apps and websites.- Proficiency in Figma.- It’s a bonus if you are versed in CSS.- The ability to work fluidly with developers, respecting both constraints and platform-specific interface guidelines.With us, youre not just developing a product, you will leave a lasting mark.Up for it? Lets talk.

title: Senior Apparel, & Accessories Designer
description: We are looking for a part or full time: Senior Apparel, & Accessories DesignerYou MUST send examples of apparel/merch you have previously created to be considered.Bonus will go to people who send examples based on our listed visions/current merch store.The role would consist of understanding the initial apparel and merchandise vision and being the creative visionary you are in order to help evolve the lineup.We have no limits to what type of apparel and accessories we are attempting to make:custom head ware - hoodies - jean jackets - leather goods - tote bags - outerwear - joggers - pullovers - sunglasses - AirPods cases - keychains - stationary items - in store retail displays - custom and unique packaging - duffle bags - backpacks - etcOrganization is a must as we work in a CRM system to keep track of projects, make revisions, and communicate with our manufactures.We have an in-house UI/UX and Web Developer, so site changes can be made instantaneously.We look forward to working with a visionary, not simply a graphic designer.Current inspiration:YSL, off-white, FOG, ATM, John Elliot, Supreme, Dior, Chateau Marmont, Gregory SiffSalary: to be discussedwww.turn.me/shop

title: Graphic Designer + Web Designer
description: About:This role supports Makers Row, an online marketplace connecting American manufacturers with diverse businesses. Our company is committed to empowering businesses with digital resources and fostering growth in the digital age.Job Description:We are seeking a talented and versatile creative Graphic + Web/UX/UI Designer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a keen eye for design and attention to detail. This role will be responsible for creating engaging and on-brand graphics for a variety of media platforms. The Graphic Designer will work full-time position and work closely with our Marketing Lead to develop and execute design concepts for our companys marketing needs.Responsibilities:1. Conceptualize and create graphics for various media platforms and websites/UX/UI, and support the ongoing management of product branding.2. Collaborate with the marketing team to develop design concepts and translate marketing strategies into innovative campaign concepts.3. Assist the Marketing Lead with content planning, management, and prioritization of multiple projects within design specifications and budget restrictions.4. Stay updated with industry developments and tools, and apply new design trends and techniques in the design process.5. Review final productions for errors and ensure that final prints reflect client specifications, maintaining a high standard of quality.Qualifications:1. Proven graphic designing experience with a strong portfolio of illustrations or other graphics, and familiarity with various social media channels and web/UX/UI designs.2. Proficiency in design software and technologies (such as Photoshop, Canva, InDesign, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, Figma).3. A keen eye for aesthetics and details, with the ability to absorb and apply constructive criticism.4. Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with the marketing team.5. Ability to work methodically, meet deadlines, and manage multiple projects.

title: Sr. Product Designer (Remote)
description: About ApolloFounded in 2015, Apollo is a leading sales intelligence and engagement platform trusted by over 13,000 paying customers, from rapidly growing startups to the largest global enterprises.Our platform unifies a database of 200 million business contacts with advanced intelligence and engagement tools, to help over 500,000 sales, marketing, and recruiting professionals to connect with the right person at the right time with the right message, at speed and scale.In the last year, we’ve grown ARR 3x, quadrupled our active users, maintained profitability 18 out of the past 20 months, and recently closed a $110M Series C led by Sequoia to fuel the next phase of our growth.Working at ApolloWe are a remote-first inclusive organization focused on operational excellence. Our way of working ensures clear expectations and an environment to do your best work with ample reward. As a product-led organization, design & user experience are at the forefront of every decision that we make.Your Role & MissionWe are hiring a Senior Product Designer to help craft the future of Apollo. Product Designers serve a vital role here in helping us learn, test, and iterate to build the best experiences possible for our users. We appreciate designers who think deeply, speak clearly, love collaboration and feedback, and are always learning about best practices to master their craft!Our Product Managers, Design, and Engineering teams are structured as Squads that are focused on several core features of the product. You will be assigned to a Squad alongside one Product Manager and multiple Engineers. You will also regularly collaborate with designers from other pods to share learnings and ensure a cohesive user experience.Daily Adventures & Responsibilities Working with the Product Manager on your squad to help brainstorm, build & validate solutions to user problems & goals. Working with Engineers on your squad to understand constraints, hand off designs, and run design QA. Collaborating with your squad during Weekly Sprint Plannings & Daily Standups to ensure that we are building the best experience. Collaborating with other Designers to provide feedback, share + learn best practices & maintain a cohesive experience in the product. Interviewing users to validate designs & learn about user problems. Using & building upon our design system to update portions of your surface. Collaborating with your squad to identify the highest impact areas to work on, develop hypothesis, test, and iterate. Consistently integrating quantitative and qualitative data into essential product decisions. Skills & Competencies 4+ years of experience designing and shipping complex web-based products founded in data and customer insights. You have expert design instincts & best practice knowledge to translate user problems, user goals, business objectives and technical constraints into excellent product experiences to deliver quick turnarounds & shorten feedback loops. You’re a self-starter that thrives while working in a fast-paced environment, working on multiple projects simultaneously. You have experience creating and maintaining components across multiple product surfaces in Figma. You are a voracious learner, constantly trying to learn how to improve customer experience, drive core metrics. Continuously learns new industry standards, staying up to date with how to get the most out of modern design tools including Figma. You have a passion for typography and copywriting and know how to write a simple, compelling microcopy to support your UI design. You’re experimentation-oriented – You have the ability to conduct user interviews, analyze the results of interviews, form hypothesis, test hypothesis with users via prototypes or product experimentation, and iterate. No big ego – we can uphold excellent rhythms within our Product Management, Engineering & Design squads because each member has respect for each other, and has a shared understanding of the goals, vision, and principles that Apollo operates on. You’re highly interested in user-centric design – we like to push each other to stay at the cutting edge of our field :) What Youll Love About ApolloWe offer a competitive salary and benefits, informal, fun, and remote working environment. Our culture thrives in openness and excellence, and we invest tremendous effort into developing our remote employees’ careers.The team embraces that we have a sole purpose: to help customers maximize their full revenue potential on the Apollo platform. This mindset opens us up to a lot of creative approaches to making customers successful at scale.Our work environment is diverse with a global remote team, and we are intentional in building an inclusive culture where everyone can be the best version of themselves. We’re also very collaborative at Apollo, so you’ll be able to lean on your teammates, even in adjacent departments, to help you achieve lofty goals. You’ll be supported and encouraged to experiment and take educated risks that lead to big wins. And, you’ll have a whole team remotely by your side to help you do it!What Else? 📚 A monthly budget for learning and development. 🏝 Unlimited PTO 🍹 Team events
location: United States India Colombia or Philippines

title: Freelance Graphic Designer
description: We are looking for a Graphic Designer to join our Sales and Marketing team to execute new and improved design across a 300+ page tools catalog. This role will work most closely with the lead Graphic Designer, Marketing Manager, and VP of Product Development in addition to other participating members of our Catalog team in Sales.We will be working off a base file from our last Catalog, produced several years ago using InDesign. The new catalog will be using the same platform (InDesign) to update our branding, product offering, and copy. The ideal candidate must have previous catalog work with examples and thorough knowledge of InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, and Acrobat.This role will be a combination of remote and in-office work. Thus, we need someone who is nearby to our office in Bridgeport, CT or able to easily commute on a weekly basis.Project length is TBD, but will be ongoing over the course of next year until completion. 20hrs minimum weekly requirement.Start Date: January 8th, 2024Breakdown of Requirements Must have previous experience designing catalogs, with examples of work Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in related field Ability to work both in our office in Bridgeport, CT and remotely, as needed 3+ years of proven experience working in Graphic Design Proficient in Adobe InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, and Acrobat A strong body of branding work Excellent collaboration skills Detail-oriented and well-organized Excellent written and verbal communication skills Outstanding time management skills and ability to handle fast turnaround times Experience with project management and collaborative tools such as Asana, Smartsheet, Teams, is a plus. Collaborate with Marketing team to establish and maintain a consistent visual identity across all marketing channels and participate in project planning meetings. Ability to take simple product photography using a lightbox and ability to touch up photos using Photoshop Ability to take on additional graphic design work if needed to support our regular operations while working with a small team. Packaging design and production experience is a plus. Ability to commit a minimum of at least 20 hours per week.

title: B2C Personal Credit Platform Design
description: Project Title: Next-Gen B2C Personal Credit Improvement Platform DesignIntroduction: The Credit Pros invites proposals from experienced UI/UX design firms for the comprehensive design revamp of our B2C Personal Credit Improvement platform. Were dedicated to enhancing consumer experiences in credit management across the United States, and we aim to bring on board a firm with a proven track record in the fintech space, particularly within consumer credit functionalities such as credit reports, monitoring, and identity protection.Project Overview: The selected firm will oversee the design overhaul of web, iOS, and Android versions of our platform. We are open to discussing the best technological stack to balance maintenance, iterative improvements, and performance efficiency - be it React/React Native, Flutter, or even low-code options like Bubble. Input on achieving optimal performance with a unified code base versus platform-specific development is sought; however, excellence in user experience is our priority.Scope of Work: Development of wireframes, interactive prototypes, and high-fidelity designs aligned with our brand and customer needs. Assessment and recommendation of design frameworks and tools, preferably Figma, for a collaborative design process. Creation of user journeys and flows, considering benchmark platforms such as Credit Karma, Credit Sesame, Wallet Hub, and Credit.com. Collaboration with our internal development team to implement the design in a seamless, agile manner. Deliverables: Comprehensive user interface designs for web and mobile applications. Design files and assets compatible with chosen development frameworks. Interactive prototypes demonstrating user flows and features. Documentation outlining design guidelines and rationale. Experience Required: Direct experience in designing fintech applications, with past projects in the consumer credit space. Proficient in standard design and prototyping tools, specifically Figma, for design collaboration. Familiarity with agile development, sprint planning, and task management in Jira. Comfortable with using Github for design version control and collaboration with developers. Timelines: The project is expected to kick off within one month from the selection date. We anticipate a design phase of 3-4 months, with a flexible approach to extend based on iterative feedback and testing outcomes.Communication: Regular communication will be maintained via email, Teams, and weekly MS Teams meetings with our project management team to ensure alignment and timely updates.Proposal Submission: Interested firms should submit proposals including: A portfolio showcasing relevant past work in fintech UI/UX design. A brief outline of your approach to the projects technology stack and design process. Estimated timelines and milestones for the design phases. Team composition and experience profiles. Confirmation of availability for the proposed timelines. Deadline for Proposal Submission: TBDWe look forward to your innovative designs and cutting-edge solutions to redefine personal credit management. Join us in revolutionizing the credit experience for consumers nationwide.

title: Digital eBook Layout designer
description: NOTE: This position is for Eastern Europe ONLY.We (at Contrast UX Agency) are currently looking for amazing brand designers to join us to designing ebook templates for a SaaS company that creates ebooks using AI and other sources. We are looking for top notch - typography is in their blood type of designers 🤩Are you a good fit? than wed love for you to apply!

title: Product and Data Visualization Designer
description: About the PositionEpoch is in search of a Product and Data Visualization Designer to own the design and visual communication of our research. In this role, you will be the creative force behind how our research is experienced and understood globally. You will help us articulate complex data and insights through UI and UX that is both intuitive and engaging, and maintain a cohesive visual identity across all of Epochs communication channels, including our website, interactive dashboards, and data visualizations. This work will be key for enhancing our dialogue with the research community and stakeholders.This role is fully remote, and we are able to hire in many countries (see full post for details). We welcome both full-time and part-time applicants, with a preference for full-time candidates. Apply here now!About EpochEpoch is a research institute that investigates trends in machine learning and the economic consequences of AI.Our work informs research and policy-making at the UK Department of Science, Innovation and Technology, Anthropic, the Centre for the Governance of AI, the Centre for Data Ethics and Innovation, Open Philanthropy, the Center for Security and Emerging Technology and elsewhere. Epoch’s research has been cited in media publications such as the MIT Technology Review and The Economist, and underpins Our World In Data’s AI visualizations.You can learn more about our work in this summary dashboard or our research reports.Key Responsibilities Maintaining and updating the design of our website. Designing graphs and visualizations for our interactive reports, papers and presentations, to ensure we are communicating our research effectively. Designing and reviewing interactive dashboards to summarize our research (example). Designing and reviewing playgrounds for interactive models of AI and automation (example 1, example 2) Designing various other external facing documents and templates, such as our newsletter or reports for stakeholders. Conducting user research and interviews with our stakeholders on design elements. Depending on your interests and skills, you could get involved in other aspects of our communications, such as homogenizing the structure and style of our papers, among others. What We Are Looking ForRequirements At least 3 years of UI and UX experience, incl. web design, graphic design, and brand design At least 1 year of data visualization experience, incl. creating charts and data visualizations for publications, marketing and UI dashboards Portfolio showcasing work in UI/UX and data visualization Aesthetic intuition to create visually appealing and effective designs Skill in communicating complex insights to non-expert audiences. Experience in Figma or a similar UI software Intellectual curiosity and open-mindedness Interest in Epoch’s work Nice to have 4 or more years of UI and UX experience. 2 or more years of data visualization experience. Familiarity with Epoch’s research or related topics. Experience with scientific communication. Front-end development experience in HTML + CSS + JS. Experience with Pyplot, Plotlib or other data visualization programming tools. Good written communication skills. BenefitsCompensation Annual salary between the following ranges pre-tax for a full-time position. $60,000 - $80,000 USD €55,604 - €74,139 £47,586 - £63,448 Payments are not restricted to the currencies listed above, and may be made in different currencies and payment intervals depending on the location of applicants and legal requirements. Other Benefits Flexible work hours and location Comprehensive global benefits package (while they vary by country, we make every effort to ensure that our benefits package is equitable and high-quality for all staff) Generous paid time off leave, including, but not limited to: Unlimited vacation with a minimum of 30 days off per year Unlimited (within reason) personal and sick leave Parental leave - up to 6 months of parental leave during the first 2 years after a child’s birth or adoption for parents of all genders For more details about our benefits, please see our Benefit Package for Permanent Roles A caring team that values respectful work relations and a healthy work-life balance Opportunities to grow/advance your career and engage in professional development For more information, see the full post.

title: Remote UI/UX Designer
description: Were Building The Future Of The WorkforceArtisan AI is revolutionizing the future of work by building out-of-the-box digital workers, called Artisans, capable of automating job functions from end to end. Our first Artisan (an outbound sales rep called Ava) is launching in under a week, and were moving at lightning speed to execute our ambitious product roadmap. We are entirely product-led, and every Artisan we create needs to be 10x better than existing solutions.Key Responsibilities Manage all UI/UX design for our platform. Create design wireframes. Design hi-fi UIs in Figma. Continuously stay up-to-date with UI/UX best practices. Create beautiful designs which are easy to navigate & flow well. About You At least 4+ years of UI design experience. A person who does not settle for good, and strives for great. A forward-thinker who can consistently come up with great, unique ideas. Somebody willing to put in hard work to meet tight deadlines. Previous experience designing a B2B SaaS product.

title: Figma Website Designer
description: About us: At Social See, we create killer websites and landing pages. Our main goal is to make stunning websites that convert like nothing else!Job Description: We are seeking a talented and creative Figma Website Designer to join our team. This role is ideal for those who are passionate about web design and have a knack for creating visually appealing and user-friendly websites and landing pages.Key Responsibilities: Design websites and landing pages in Figma. (Wireframes and copy are provided for each project) Translate client requirements into creative design solutions. Stay updated with the latest design trends and tools. Requirements: Proven experience in web design, specifically using Figma. Portfolio showcasing your web design skills (landing pages design is a huge plus). Strong understanding of design principles and user experience. Excellent communication skills and fluency in English. Why Join Us? Work in a flexible, remote environment. Include your resume, portfolio, and a brief cover letter explaining why you are a great fit for this role. Please start your Quick cover letter with an answer to whats 5+9.Looking forward to working together!🥳

title: Associate Head of Design
description: Die NXT YOU GmbH ist ein innovatives und zukunftsorientiertes Unternehmen, welches neben SAAS-Lösungen in erster Linie, für das gestalten und bauen von Apps für kleine als auch große Unternehmen bekannt ist. Im Vordergrund steht dabei, das optimale Ergebnis für Unternehmen und deren Kunden zu erzielen. Darüber hinaus bietet das Team rund um Clemens Kauschke Business Development und Content Creation für die Sozialen Medien. NXT YOU verkörpert Kreativität, Leistung, Qualität, Zukunft und “THE NEW WAY OF WORK”.Wir suchen einen engagierten und motivierten Head of Design Associate, der Teil unseres wachsenden Design Teams werden möchte. In dieser Rolle wirst du eng mit unserem Head of Design zusammenarbeiten und eigenverantwortlich Aufgaben übernehmen.Deine Aufgaben: Konzeption und Design von verschiedenen Projekten, einschließlich Apps, Websites, Animationen -und Social Media-Inhalten. Kommunikation mit dem gesamten Team, um Designstrategien und -konzepte klar und effizient zu kommunizieren. Projektmanagement: Organisation von Projekten, Einhaltung von Fristen und effiziente Ressourcenverwaltung. Eigenverantwortliche Übernahme von Designprojekten und Unterstützung des Teams bei Bedarf. Deine Qualifikation: Design Skills: Du verfügst über ein solides Maß an Designfähigkeiten mit einem hohen Anspruch an Qualität, sowie ein vielseitiges Skillset, das sich über verschiedene Designbereiche erstreckt. Kommunikationsfähigkeiten: Schnelle und präzise Kommunikation innerhalb des Teams Projektmanagement: Du hast Erfahrungen im Bereich Projektorganisation und die Fähigkeit Deadlines einzuhalten und Ressourcen effizient zu verwalten. Verantwortung & Zuverlässigkeit: Du bist bereit, bei Bedarf die Extra-Meile zu gehen. Wir bieten viel Flexibilität und Verständnis, erwarten jedoch volles Engagement, insbesondere in herausfordernden Zeiten. Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift Deine Benefits:Ein offenes und flexibles Arbeitsumfeld, in dem Eigenverantwortung und Selbstentwicklung gefördert werden. Bei uns gibt es flache Hierarchien und Raum für Kreativität sowie persönliche Entfaltung. Die Stelle bietet die Möglichkeit zum Aufstieg in Leitende Positionen. Ebenfalls, bieten wir bei überdurchschnittlichem Engagement, die Teilnahme bei Team Reisen an. Unser Ziel ist es, gemeinsam zu wachsen und Großes zu erreichen.

title: Freelance Book Designer / Illustrator
description: We are seeking talented book designers and illustrators to join our fast-growing community of top talent in publishing. Reedsys vetted group of freelancers have worked on a range of widely acclaimed novels, such as The Hunger Games, Originals (Adam Grant), and His Dark Materials series (Phillip Pullman).There are hundreds of authors currently looking for designers and illustrators on Reedsy. Reedsy allows you to pick which genres youd like to work on so you only receive projects in your area of interest. You will work where and when you want, and set your own rates.Our selection requirements are:- Full-time professional experience in design.- Minimum 3+ years of experience.- Demonstrated experience on at least 5 published and well-reviewed books (available on Amazon, Google Play or Apple Books).A history of high-quality work with a bestselling author or on a bestselling book, or experience with a renowned publishing company will be positively valued.If you are curious, here is a look at some recent cover art by Reedsy professionals: https://blog.reedsy.com/book-cover-art/.

title: Senior Product Designer
description: DescriptionAbout MurmurationMurmuration is a nonprofit organization focused on leveraging civic engagement to drive greater equity. We provide sophisticated tools, data, strategic guidance, and programmatic support to help our partner organizations increase civic engagement and marshal support to drive change at the community level. Our best-in-class data and easy-to-use tools have been used by hundreds of organizations to make informed decisions about who they need to reach and how to achieve and sustain impact – and to put those decisions into action.Note: At Murmuration, we are committed to becoming an even more diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. To this end, all staff members are expected to actively participate in DEI (diversity, equity, inclusion) programming.About the RoleThis is a full-time position reporting to our Manager of UX Design and joining a close-knit group of Product Designers.As a Senior Product Designer, you will play a pivotal role in determining the look, feel, and user experience for one of our products within a growing product portfolio including enterprise software tools and mobile apps. You’ll dive into the weeds wherever needed within your product Pod to help keep the team moving. Based on the business and product context, constraints, and requirements, you’ll focus on designing what drives the most impact: innovating where it drives a key outcome and building from prior learnings to avoid reinventing the wheel.What Youll Do: Effectively and empathically collaborate with cross-functional teams of researchers, product managers, engineers, marketers, and data scientists; Advocate for and employ user-centered design methodologies to thoroughly understand customer goals and pain points, and help others do the same; Design early-stage product ideas, learn from experiments, iterate quickly to propose new hypotheses, and deliver actionable insights to your team; Deliver end-to-end feature design work, including user journeys and flows, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes; Regularly present designs to stakeholders for feedback and to the company at large Mentor and collaborate with other designers to apply best practices, learn cutting edge techniques, and coordinate on a rich product ecosystem; and Help drive continuous improvement of our design practice from tools to process to team culture RequirementsWhat You Should Have Passion for civic engagement, campaigns, and equitability; Excellent product design fundamentals, including visual design, UI design, interaction design, and information architecture; Demonstrable real-world design expertise in complex SaaS products on teams using Agile software development methodologies; Skill in strategizing at a high level then breaking down and targeting the tactical pieces to realize the vision in a phased approach; Expertise in creating and using design systems to drive consistency and reusability throughout a suite of products; Deep understanding of accessibility and responsive/adaptive design to accommodate different form factors; A bias for action and the ability to thrive working in fast-paced climates (e.g., start-up or similar); A strong commitment to data-driven decision making: welcoming both qualitative and quantitative data on the impact of our products to enrich the iterative design process; Mastery of industry-standard design and collaboration tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Jira, and Miro (or equivalent); and A portfolio that showcases how you designed real world solutions and the role you played in bringing them to life (online is preferred). What you could have: Experience with CRMs, political or advocacy campaigns, and/or civic organizing products; Experience with analytics tools such as Pendo, Mixpanel, Fullstory, Google Analytics, or similar; Design expertise in data visualization; Visual identity branding experience; and/or Training in behavioral science (RCTs, interventions, etc.) Talented Senior Product Designers come from all walks of life and career. If you are passionate about civic engagement and technology, please apply, even if you do not check every box!BenefitsLocation, Compensation, and BenefitsThe Senior Product Designer is a full-time, salaried position with a comprehensive benefits package. It is based anywhere in the U.S. The salary range for this position is $115,000 - $135,000 and is commensurate with experience.Our Culture of CareWe work hard to create a culture of care to ensure that our staff are best equipped to lead happy, healthy, and balanced lives. To that end, we offer a comprehensive benefits package which includes: Health, vision, and dental insurance with 100% of premiums covered for you and qualifying family members; Retirement benefits with a 4% employer match; A flexible unlimited PTO plan; Generous paid parental leave; Pre-tax commuter benefits; A company laptop; A flexible remote work environment; A home office setup stipend for all new employees; Monthly reimbursement for remote work expenses; A yearly professional development fund; Mental health and wellness benefits through Calm and Better Help; Yearly in-person staff retreats; A welcoming culture that celebrates diversity, equity, and inclusion. An Equal-Opportunity Employer with a Commitment to DiversityMurmuration is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and as an organization committed to diversity and the perspective of all voices, we consider applicants equally of race, gender, color, sexual orientation, religion, marital status, disability, political affiliation, and national origin. We reasonably accommodate staff members and/or applicants with disabilities, provided they are otherwise able to perform the essential functions of the job.

Collaboration with a passionate small team committed to creating original artwork. An opportunity for professional growth and development within the company.

title: UI / UX Designer & Gaming Enthusiast
description: 🐬 Fluyo is a startup looking for a legendary UX designer who will transform our well designed & fun language learning app into an incredibly well designed & even more fun app! Someone who through data/research, good intuition and design taste will level up our product user’s experience to the maximum level.Our mission at Fluyo is to make the world speak another language by making language learning truly fun. We combine the most effective language education with all the fun of a video game.🧑‍🏫 Industry: Language Learning🧑‍💻 Seniority: Mid/Senior (you will be the primary UX/UI designer in our team)🏢 Company Size: 5 to 10 employees💰 Salary: €40k-55k EUR / $45k-60k USD per year📈 Equity: 0.1 - 0.25%Perks-⏱ Flexible working hours (work whenever you want, but be available to chat during core hours: 8-11am EST / 2-5pm CET)- 🌍 100% Remote working (our team is based in 7 different countries worldwide)- 💰 Funded on Kickstarter (highest funded app in Kickstarter history!)- 🚀 Make a real difference (we are publicly launching in several months, so this is a really exciting time to join!)- 🏖️ Unlimited vacation time: You are in charge of deciding when to work.- 🐣 Be an early team member + equity (as the company grows, your role will grow, and so will all the rewards!)- 😎 A chilled out team (we work hard, but we do not micromanage at all)Essential Skills Required 3+ years of UX experience, high level proficiency with Adobe XD / Figma, and an elegant & modern portfolio Experience in game design or extensive gaming experience (the majority of Fluyo is either a game or very gamified, we need someone who is familiar with common gaming mechanics) Your files, components, prototypes and designs are highly organized You love learning new languages and have used various language learning apps You love talking to customers/users to get product feedback and can turn this feedback into designs You possess a strong intuition for what you believe users would like based on your own experience (not solely relying on research & data) You absolutely love UX, and constantly think about how your designs will affect user happiness and success You enjoy working closely with developers to ensure your designs are implemented correctly The RoleYou will be the main product designer in the team, and will be responsible for taking our current (slightly messy) XD file and transforming it into a professional, modern UI kit & design. You will then be responsible for collecting and analyzing user feedback from our app, to determine what features users want added or improved, and then you will determine their feasibility and turn them into prototypes (and then full designs).You will be responsible for anything that users interact with (and how they exactly interact with) on the app. We want someone who is bright, hard working and has a great user experience and visual design taste. We want someone who can take charge over our product and envision all the potential ways our product’s user experience can be improved, design said improvements and work with our developers to ensure your designs are matched and do QA. Please add the word “Goldshire” to your application so we know you read this post completely. Ultimately, the goal of this role is to help make our app an absolute joy for our customers to use.Essentially, we need someone who is a professional and talented designer, but also someone who cares deeply about products and customers, and is always thinking about how to make our product more useful/enjoyable.This is a full time requirement (approx. 7 hours per day) for 1 designer. Please no agencies. We want someone who can commit to our team and focus exclusively on this. We are not looking for a freelancer who has multiple projects on at the same time.Our CompanyWere a language learning app that will completely change the way people learn languages. Were making a language learning app that is truly fun and addictive. It’s not simply “a gamified app”, it’s an actual game. A game that has been designed from the ground up to also be the most effective language learning system that’s ever existed. Other apps can be effective, but often are not truly fun and are very difficult to use consistently. Hence users rely on forcing themselves to use them.In contrast, our app inspires excitement, acts as a platform for learners to make friends, is extremely fun, easy to use consistently and therefore makes one’s language learning journey so much better. We just became the most funded app on Kickstarter ever, and you can see our campaign and learn more about our product here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/550782470/fluyoInterview Process Application form (below) We review your portfolio, if we think you are potential fit, we’ll send you a small paid design / user flow critique test Video call with CTO & CEO Thanks so much for checking out our job! We cant wait to read your application and (hopefully) welcome you to our team! Even if this job is not a good fit for you, we will keep your contact details and email you about future jobs that fit your profile. We are going to be hiring a lot in 2023!

title: Brand Designer
description: About komootKomoot is an app that lets you find, plan, and share adventures with its easy route planner. Driven by a love for nature and powered by the outdoor community’s recommendations, komoot helps you explore more of the great outdoors—wherever and however you want. And were good at it. Google and Apple have listed us as one of their Apps of the Year numerous times. Today, with over 35 million users and 300,000 five-star reviews, we are well on our way to becoming the most popular app for finding, planning, and sharing adventures worldwide.Join our remote-working team and start your adventure with komoot.About the roleWe’re looking for an adventurous designer with a background in marketing and branding to help us in our mission to establish komoot as the world’s most-loved, relatable and inspiring brand in the outdoor community. You’ll join a fantastic team which gets to play with generous media, ads and community event budgets – a job every communication designer would dream to have, and one every talented designer deserves! With over 35 million users, our platform ensures your work will be seen and heard.Ready for your next adventure?What you will do Team up with our design, brand, and marketing teams to create brand assets and beautiful campaigns that inspire millions of outdoor enthusiasts to create their own adventures. Use your various design skills for a diverse range of communication assets — such as campaign landing pages, email newsletters, social media assets, mobile ads, print, merch, and much more. Test and optimize your work to ensure our message reaches our intended target audience. Working alongside our design and marketing teams to develop and refine our visual language to strengthen our brand identity. Why you will love it Your work will contribute to helping millions of people enjoy lovely outdoor experiences. We’ve been a remote-working company since 2017, meaning: We are remote by default, have frameworks and systems in place, and know how to do it well. You’ll become an essential part of our diverse and international team with colleagues based in 15+ countries across Europe. You can work from wherever you want, be it a beach, the mountains, your house, or anywhere else that lies in any time zone between UTC-1 and UTC+3. 38 paid days off (inclusive public holidays) – you are free to take those days whenever it suits you, including a well-deserved winter holiday break. We love seeing people grow. Thats why each team member gets €2,000 and 3 additional days to spend on professional development each year. Classes, conferences, books – your choice! Costs covered for your co-working space membership or your work-from-home office setup and the latest devices and equipment to do your best work. You’ll be successful in this role if you Have an excellent portfolio showcasing relevant design experience and can explain your rationale Have experience in designing successful advertising campaigns and have seen projects through from initial concept to launch Can use your creative thinking to surprise and engage our community Have knowledge of HTML & CSS Understand how to analyze brand research and find the opportunities for brand growth Have a hands-on attitude and are highly self-driven and keen to learn Understand printing processes and setting up print ready artwork Bonus Experience designing and coding email campaigns Motion design or animation skills Video editing experience Not sure if you meet all requirements above? Dont sweat it – if you think youre the right person anyway, wed love to hear from you!Curious about how we work? Core Communication time between 10 am - 3 pm (Berlin Time). We know people have different lifestyles, which is why we have flexible working hours with core time for synchronous interaction. You can organize your workday in the way that best suits you, your family, and your needs. We work on a project basis in cross functional teams to ensure that we collaborate on our goals, move forward smoothly with open lines of communication, and achieve results as a team. Every Monday morning, we have a whole-company presentation where you hear about projects across the business, inspire each other, and share great work. We connect in person at three whole-company gatherings each year in beautiful locations. You can check out this playlist to find out more about how we stay close while being remote. We use tools like Trello, Slack, Miro, Zoom, and Google Drive on a daily basis to stay connected, collaborate easily, and manage projects. Dive a little deeper and learn… More about our team here: Meet the Team More about how we work here: How We Work More about our recruitment process and FAQs here: FAQs We support diversity and inclusivity and welcome all prospective applicants. We have an ongoing recruitment process (no deadlines) – if this role is online, it means it’s still open!

title: Freelance Presentation Designer
description: Overview:Hellotickets is looking for a Freelance Presentation Designer. This project-based role involves redesigning a sales presentation, focusing on layout, design, and content to effectively showcase our travel services.Responsibilities: Redesign the sales presentation to be visually appealing and content-rich. Collaborate with our team for content accuracy and brand alignment. Qualifications: Experience in both design and content enhancement for sales/presentatioPDF materials. What We Offer: A chance to significantly impact our brand. Potential for ongoing collaborations.

title: Graphic Designer
description: LayerZeroThe Future is Omnichain.Founded in 2021, LayerZero’s vision is to create a community of cross-chain developers, building dApps that are no longer constrained by individual blockchain capabilities. With LayerZeros simple, generic messaging protocol, builders will develop cross-chain dApps designed to unify the power of individual blockchains.We are funded by the best investors in the world including:a16z, Sequoia, PayPal, Binance Ventures, Coinbase Ventures, Uniswap Labs, Circle Ventures, Delphi Digital, and many more.ABOUT THE ROLEWe are seeking a skilled Graphic Designer to join LayerZero. As a Graphic Designer, you will be responsible for creating designs that align with our brand standards and effectively communicate our message to our target audience. You will play a key role in developing and strengthening our brand assets, ensuring consistency across various marketing channels.WHAT YOU’LL DO Meet project deadlines and collaborate effectively with team members to ensure timely delivery of design projects. Utilize your experience in strategic implementation of brand standards to maintain and enhance our brand identity. Develop and refine brand assets, including style guides and brand guidelines, to ensure consistent and cohesive visual representation across all marketing materials. Create creative assets such as graphics, templates, layouts, and visual standards for marketing activities across multiple channels, including web, social media, product packaging, email campaigns, and more. ABOUT YOU 3+ years experience with industry-standard design software such as Figma and the Adobe Creative Suite to create high-quality and professional designs.Proven ability to meet deadlines and effectively collaborate with team members in a fast-paced environment. Demonstrated experience in implementing brand standards strategically to create visually cohesive designs. Strong portfolio displaying a range of design projects that highlight your creativity and technical skills. Proficiency in using design tools such as Figma and the Adobe Creative Suite. Excellent attention to detail and the ability to deliver high-quality work. Strong communication skills to effectively convey design concepts and collaborate with cross-functional teams. Ability to adapt to evolving design trends and techniques. Equal Opportunity EmployerLayerZero Labs is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. LayerZero Labs is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

title: PRO Social Media Graphic Designer
description: Were a Halal meal prep delivery company in Ontario, Canada and were looking for an awesome social media graphic designer to generate ads, ad variants, social media posts, engagement posts - you name it!Were looking for an experienced graphic designer that has extensive experience creating on-brand, on-trend advertisements & posts that just POP on social media. Were talking Facebook, Instagram, TikTok, Reddit, and the rest. Ideally, you know how to work with images and videos, but if images/graphic design is your thing then great.Well be honest - were not looking for shiny looking ads that dont perform. Your graphic design skills should help us create amazing social media advertisements and engagement posts to help drive our growth over the long-term!If youd like your hand at designing for a company thats as exciting as HelloFresh and Factor, then join our side! Be part of our growth story by bringing your eye for design and social media engagement skills to our team! 💪🏽

title: Product Designer
description: MailerLite is one of the fastest-growing email marketing services. We help more than 1 million businesses around the world to keep in touch with their customers. Today, we are a team of more than 130 dreamers, adventurers, and world travelers passionate about what we do and believe in. And we are ready for another talented person to join the party.This time, were looking for a Product Designer who will play a crucial role in shaping the user experience and visual design of our transactional email service. Your innovative ideas and design expertise will contribute to the development of a product that empowers businesses and enhances their communication strategies. 🚀Why MailerLite?Wondering why we think you’ll love working for MailerLite? Here are 6 reasons! Youll craft with creativity Great design is at the heart of everything we do, and youll be the driving force behind it. Youll grow, develop and evolve As part of a team thats always looking for new, innovative ways to offer value for customers, youll constantly be experimenting, learning, and trying out new things. Youll take ownership We expect you to take full responsibility and ownership of your tasks. Team leads avoid micromanaging and minimize interruptions so you can stay focused on your assignments. You’ll have experts at hand Whenever you’re stuck, your teammates with a wide range of different expertise are ready to help you grow. And they’d love for you to share your knowledge too! Youll pick where you work, every day We embrace the remote culture. Every day you get to choose what environment makes you most productive. Youll have stability We value a stable workplace! MailerLite has been thriving for over 10 years and our year-over-year growth continues to increase. What you’ll work withIn this role, as a multidisciplinary Product Designer, you will have the exciting opportunity to shape both the product’s UI and UX. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, project managers, and marketers, you will delve into understanding user needs and translating them into intuitive and visually appealing designs. From crafting user interfaces to creating engaging email templates, you will work on a wide range of design projects, ensuring that every touchpoint delivers a seamless user experience. When a design is finalised, you will closely collaborate with our development team to ensure the front end aligns perfectly with the intended design. This collaboration aims to maintain consistency and fidelity between the design and the final implementation, ensuring that the product’s visual appeal and functionality are brought to life harmoniously. This role entails a big focus on UI/UX design, allowing you to utilise your expertise in creating captivating experiences for our users. While it is important to have a good knowledge of HTML and CSS, we do not expect extensive front-end development skills. Instead, your primary focus will be on delivering outstanding design solutions that enhance user engagement and satisfaction.What we expect from you Youve worked as a designer for at least 2 years and have a keenness for identifying user needs, defining clear solutions, and delivering those through detailed design You’re proficient with design tools such as Figma or Sketch You have basic front-end skills (HTML/CSS) and knowledge of development frameworks such as Tailwind or Bootstrap - these abilities are crucial for this role You have practical knowledge of color theory, grid layout, typography, and graphic design You have outstanding attention to detail (when you apply, include the phrase love my job somewhere in your application) Youre an open-minded person with the ability to adapt and acquire technical knowledge quickly You have excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills in English Huge plus if you have experience in SaaS product design We will be able to consider your application only if you are based in Europe, Africa, or eastern regions of the Americas (EDT and CDT time zones) Bonus skills You have basic knowledge of Vue.js, Alpine.js or JavaScript in general You have some copywriting experience What we offer Yearly salary $40,000-$75,000 (gross) Remote-first culture with the team working remotely from all over the world International health insurance provided with coverage in most countries. Monthly health care payout available in select countries where coverage is limited Company-paid retreats. Once per year we gather for a week in an exotic location to work, learn and have fun together 31 days of vacation per year. We encourage you to unplug and recharge! 12 paid sick days for your physical and mental well-being, no doctors note required. Parents can use them to care for their sick children 4 creative days. One paid day off per quarter to do something creative and fun 12 parental days per year. Enjoy one paid day off each month to treasure time with your children Parental leave. Enjoy paid bonding time at 100% of your salary when welcoming a new child into your family through birth or adoption - 3 months of maternity leave and 1 month of paternity leave Parenting budget of $1000. Celebrate the arrival of your little one, whether through childbirth or adoption, with a special gift from us Joy Budget. Annual budget to spend on whatever that brings you joy MacBook and other tools thatll help you to do your job efficiently Check the full list of our awesome benefits here For more information, visit our Hiring journey and FAQ pages.

title: UX/UI Designer (Hybrid) in Bangkok
description: We are a team of passionate software engineers, product managers, and designers that enjoy building outstanding web and mobile applications.Millions of people use our apps. We work for companies of all sizes; from 1-person startups to Fortune 500 enterprises. We take a collaborative and product development approach, creating custom software that people will love to use and solving our clients problems so that they can focus on what they do best - better.If you want to grow together, work on challenging products and enjoy using the best tools and practices, Nimble is the right place for you! We keep our recruitment process practical and straightforward.To learn more about how we work, check our handbook named Compass, Github organization, and Medium account.Want to see what we have built? Check our Dribbble and Behance accounts.Want to keep in touch with us? Follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn. At Nimble, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where all individuals are treated with respect and have an equal opportunity to thrive.What does the ideal candidate look like?Technical Knowledge You master the tools of your craft such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe CC, etc. You are intimately familiar with all core steps of the design process: user research, user flows, wireframing, and UI design. You have expert knowledge of user experience, design patterns, and platform-specific design (e.g., iOS vs. Android). You know how to create advanced, highly dynamic, and convincing prototypes. You continuously stay up-to-date with industry trends, tools, and frameworks. OrganizationYou have excellent time management and work organization skills.Communication You have an English Professional working proficiency (ILR level 3). You have great listening and cross-functional collaboration skills. You are used to working closely with Engineers to see through the correct implementation of your designs. BonusYou have some experience with development.What does a typical workday look like?Although each day is usually different and presents its own challenges, there are common themes that you will face every day. Discovering new projects, understanding the pain points and users’ expectations, and defining how to approach the problems or innovations through user experience. Designing, wireframing, prototyping. Supporting Engineering with design implementation. Interacting with Product Managers and iterating on designs. Interacting with external stakeholders, listening to and understanding their feedback while defending your design decisions. Reporting and providing insights to the Chief Product Officer. Identifying and leading new design initiatives. Why Youll Love Working Here You will be proud of any product that has our name on it. We really pay attention and care about processes, high quality, and aesthetics. Strong processes. We not only believe but also really work following agile principles. Regular one-on-one reviews to constantly improve and grow. The vast amount of learning resources (Pluralsight, Pragpub, Leanpub, (e-)books, etc.) and yearly education allowance to step up your game. Provident Fund which allows you to save money every month and we match your monthly contributions. Private medical insurance (Allianz) from day one, company care fund and social welfare coverage. M2 MacBook, large screens, and any accessory to let you work comfortably. Casual work attire for everyone. Comfortable and modern office space environment in the heart of Bangkok next to BTS Asoke and MRT Sukhumvit (Interchange 21). Our office kitchen is fully stocked with drinks and snacks for the team. Visa and work permit for foreigners. If you live abroad, we provide a relocation assistance package consisting of a plane ticket allowance and up to 2 weeks of initial accommodation. 25 days of paid leaves/year (13 public holidays + 12 personal days). Sabbatical month every 3 years. Many more perks!

title: Seeking Skilled Web App Animator
description: We are hoping to add some animations and fun visual interactions into our writing application. If you are a designer that has done beautiful animations, buttons, dashboards, or visual representation of data or information - please send me a message with your portfolio. We are hiring immediately.

title: Graphic Design Associate
description: Artistic Tile is seeking a gifted Graphic Design Associate to join our exceptional marketing design team. The designer will work within the marketing department to produce content under the direction of the Art Director, creating collateral for use on the company’s website, in printed materials, in digital communications, and in print and digital advertising campaigns. Artistic Tile is a luxury tile and stone design, import, distribution, and retail company that’s family owned and operated. We are leaders in the field due to the importance we place on design innovation, quality control, and customer service. Design is central to what we do, and graphic design is one of our primary means of communicating our brand identity and design aesthetic to our audiences. The position requires significant hands-on work, time and project management skills, and mastery of the Adobe suite. Great candidates for this position are truly creative with a strong design sense, are confident in their skills, and are willing to advocate for their vision with the patience to work within an approval process in which those visions will not always be realized. The best designs rise to the top here, receive our full support, and are often published internationally. The marketing team you will join is staffed with professionals who excel in their roles, are consultative and supportive, and who can produce at high levels to create the content to help make your vision real. The company you will join is a recognized leader in the field. It will be your job to uphold and enhance its reputation of excellence through compelling creative work. This job operates out of Artistic Tile’s Secaucus, NJ headquarters. It’s right outside of Manhattan and an easy commute. Candidates must: Be excellent communicators Provide a portfolio with their application Provide recent and enthusiastic references Excel in a collaborative environment Respond well to constructive criticism Enjoy creating groundbreaking graphic design work that stands out Be tuned into the trends in the design world, with an active interest in emerging and excellent design Education & Experience: Bachelor’s Degree in Graphic Design; BFA preferred Have 1+ years in a similar field with luxury experience a plus Skills: Adobe Creative Suite Adobe After Effects HTML Web Design Bonus points for experience with: Netsuite, CRM, Adwords, SEM, SEO, Social Media, Shopify Plus, Basecamp, Microsoft Teams, Retail Store DesigMerchandising, Fiery, Printing Methods & Techniques, Photography, Video Creation & Editing, 3D Visualization & Rendering. Job Type: Full-time

title: Lead Mobile Product Designer
description: Lead Mobile Product DesignerAbout this RoleAs a Lead Mobile Product Designer, you will partner with a Product Lead, an Engineering Lead, and a team of developers (we call this a “Squad”) to design and deliver mobile experiences that support our mission to help people experience the Bible as a unified story that leads to Jesus.You will lead discovery activities that help your Squad understand the needs of our audience, and you will develop concepts and prototypes for products and features that address those needs. You’ll move product ideas from loose concepts, to testable prototypes, to high-fidelity assets for developer handoff.In all your work, you will bring your skills and experience to help further our mission of helping people experience the Bible as a unified story that leads to JesusWhat You’ll Be Doing Lead discovery activities; interviews, competitive reviews, surveys, and usability studies Synthesize discovery insights and identify new areas for product improvement Develop stories, sketches, wireframes, and prototypes of new product features and ideas Test new product features and ideas with our audience to inform decisions and iterations Deliver well organized design assets to engineers What We’re Looking For Significant contribution to the design of two or more mobile apps that have been developed and deployed. A portfolio of work examples that demonstrate process and final products Significant experience with mobile design patterns for Android and iOS Experience collaborating with product managers, engineers, and other internal stakeholders Demonstrable experience with team leadership Skilled using modern design tools (e.g., Figma) to produce wireframes, mockups, and interactive prototypes About BibleProjectPortland, Oregon, Founded in 2014BibleProject is a nonprofit, crowdfunded organization that produces 100% free Bible videos, podcasts, blogs, classes, and educational Bible resources. Our mission is to help people experience the Bible as a unified story that leads to Jesus.We are rapidly growing in the area of multimedia technology. What began with two animated videos now encompasses multiple platforms and products—including over 160 videos. Our website and app serve as connection hubs to our ever-growing library of resources. Classroom, our online learning platform, offers accessible, graduate-level Bible classes. These, and all of our supporting products, continue to be completely free to audiences around the world, thanks to the ongoing generosity of our patrons.Location: This role must be performed within the United States. Occasional travel to Portland, Oregon.Beginning: January 2024Reporting to: Nathan Sinsabaugh, Product Design ManagerCompensation & Benefits: The salary range for this role is $100,000 - $125,000 based on experience directly related to this role. Competitive salary that scales with experience directly related to this role. Top tier in non-profit market but will not match technology companies Medical, dental, vision, life, short and long term disability insurance for employee and family with premiums covered 100% by BibleProject 401(k) with 4% employer match Flexible PTO Paid parental leave Paid learning stipend A culture focused on belonging and thriving BibleProject is an equal opportunity employer

title: Senior Designer
description: About us: Highwire is a modern communications agency designed for disruptive companies. As the top-ranked digital marketing and strategic communications firm, we work with high-growth technology companies to establish consumer brands looking to reinvent themselves. At Highwire, we believe that storytelling fuels transformation. And the most impactful stories represent all voices and perspectives. As a values-driven agency, we foster an inclusive environment where everyone—regardless of age, race/ethnicity, size, shape, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion and different abilities–can feel safe, celebrated and worthy. We ensure every Highwire Walker has unique support to climb to success. Our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging is permanent and foundational to our business and culture. We aspire to change our industry and build a better future for all.Our people-first culture is driven by four core values: Inclusion Always Growth Mindset Team Empowerment Fierce Distinction We’re looking for individuals with big ideas, strong opinions, and the energy to bring them to life. If you thrive in an environment that values personal accountability, high standards, and boundless motivation, this is the opportunity for you. Be part of our award-winning culture and contribute to an exciting and growing business where you can make a real impact. We are based in San Francisco, with offices in New York, Boston, and Chicago. However, we are also open to hiring in the following states: Connecticut, Florida, Indiana, Michigan, Missouri, New Jersey, North Carolina, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Texas, Utah, Vermont, and Washington.Highwire’s creative team sits within the agency’s digital practice. We lead the creative strategy, design and execution of powerful, valuable, and impactful ideas that drive business impact for our clients.We weave insights into ideas, make ideas real, and combine creativity with strategic storytelling so our clients stand out from competitors. We believe the biggest ideas don’t have to be the most complex and in the importance of matching creative delivery with strategic motivation. About the job: As a Senior Designer, youll work closely with the Creative team to drive the development of visual assets and design elements for a variety of internal and external projects, including strategies, events, social media, digital content, email, visual identity development, and more. This includes the compilation, design and layout of company decks, presentations, client strategies, branded collateral, digital mockups, and other creative assets.Youll work seamlessly with our creative strategy leads, design director, digital strategists, project managers, and digital designers to create awe-inspiring ideas, campaigns, and assets.About you: Creativity and Technical Fluency: Your portfolio demonstrates a high-caliber understanding of visual design across a number of mediums including print, graphics, UI, e-mail, spatial, packaging, merch and more. You can simultaneously push to think outside the box, while working within brand parameters. You have mastery over Figma and the Adobe Creative Suite, including Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign (Bonus if you have experience working with Premiere and After Effects.), as well as Keynote and Powerpoint/Google Slides. Professionalism and project management: You have a buttoned-up approach to project management, with the ability to juggle multiple projects at once, both when collaborating as a team and managing independently. You have exquisite attention to detail. Communication and Problem-Solving: You are an excellent writer and communicator, with the ability to self-motivate, pivot as needed, and voice frictions and roadblocks as they arise. You possess a solution-oriented attitude.*Please click on the job link to review the full job description

title: Senior Product Designer
description: Who we are:Axion’s mission is to create the world’s best automotive and aerospace engineering management analytics platform, powered by machine learning. We’re revolutionizing the way next-gen vehicles are made and have partnered with forward-looking engineering leaders to deploy machine learning models that will accelerate our speed to an electric, connected, supersonic future. Our team includes experts in Machine Learning, Enterprise AI, and SaaS from GoogleX, Spotify, Microsoft, Palantir, McKinsey & QuantumBlack, and other top tech companies. Since our founding at the onset of 2021, we’ve deployed across some of the largest Automotive and Aerospace companies in the world. If you want the chance to help build the future of engineering leadership, join us.Why Us:Join a fast-growing, early-stage startup with the chance to make a significant impact from day one. Our culture puts people first. We will encourage you to bring your full self to work and will set you up to succeed.You’ll also get: Highly competitive compensation Meaningful equity Leadership opportunity in a high-growth company A great team. We bring a unique combination of technical and business skills, with company leaders from top tech companies like Spotify, business leadership from McKinsey, and automotive leadership from GM and Ford. We’re an interdisciplinary team that prizes collaboration & diversity of thinking. Where you’ll be:Prefer an office to work? We have options for your working preferences. Prefer to work from home? You can Work From Anywhere at Axion.We are looking for a Product Designer who will: Strategise, sketch and design new products and features for a diverse set of users Translate user requirements and your own research into tangible design concepts to bring a product concept to life quickly Help run short design sprints and work in a fast-moving, agile environment Be able to conduct your own user research as well as building and testing prototypes Feel equally comfortable sketching and wireframing a design solution as you are making UI and data visualisations look beautiful and compelling Ideally help build out a design system and help develop patterns and components for re-use with our engineering teams Your expertise: 5 years’ experience designing user-centred products and enterprise applications, ideally with experience visualising data An awe-inspiring portfolio and a design process that you can articulate clearly Excellent communication skills and the ability to explain the rationale behind your design concepts Experience with agile methodologies and integrating design with cross-functional delivery teams An obsessive attention-to-detail in everything you do, from storytelling and clarity of communication through to detailed wireframes and UI designs Experience working with data science teams in an enterprise environment would be a huge advantage. Knowledge and experience using tools such as Figma and Adobe Creative Suite Come work with us, were growing!

title: Product Designer
description: About the CompanyPlant level knowledge is vital to satisfying the food production needs from projected a forty percent increase in world population over the next thirty years. We support that goal by continuously and automatically assessing the health and performance of the world’s +$1T specialty crops, one plant at a time, with deep learning and imaging. Currently, Bloomfield is focused on wine, table, and juice grapes as well as, more recently, blueberries. Our portable Flash cameras and supporting platform capture, geo-locate and share the condition of each vine, tree and bush, along with the various features of that plant. This information, in turn, informs a variety of decisions and actions that growers take every day to increase the size, quality and consistency of yields and doing so without increasing the resources used to produce those yields.About the RoleWe are looking for a dynamic Product Designer who will be responsible for the user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design of various digital assets. The Product Designer will ensure that all elements of the online user experience are optimized for improved usability, usefulness, and exceptional visual design. This is full-time, hybrid position (located at our Pittsburgh, PA office). Responsibilities: Create new UI designs from early concepts through wireframes and developer-ready comps Plan and conduct concept reviews for new features, work with existing and prospective customers to validate design concepts Work closely with product and engineering teammates to drive design process Own design for user-facing web application, operator-facing tablet and hardware interaction Iterate on existing brand guidelines and lead updates where necessary (i.e. website, marketing materials, internal branding) Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Graphic Design or UI/UX Design or related field and/or 2-5 years of experience in a Product UI/UX Design or related role Proficient with at least one UI design wireframe and prototyping tool – such as Sketch, Zeplin, Axure, Figma or others A strong portfolio that demonstrates your experience and design presentation skills Aptitude for technical domains and information architecture, to design UX for inherently complex products Created new UI designs from early concepts through wireframes to developer-ready comps Familiarity with web-based products/ applications and common front end code (HTML, CSS, etc.) Ability to perform in a fast-paced environment of agile software development Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact with team members User-Centric/deep understanding of information architecture principles Nice to Have Experience: Experience with startups Experience with map-based or GIS information Experience with Digital Agriculture or Precision Agriculture tools What We Offer:In addition to the opportunity to apply and develop your skills toward key business objectives, we offer an excellent compensation package including: Competitive base salary Medical, dental and vision insurance 401(k) retirement plan with company match Unlimited PTO Parental Leave Incentive Stock Options Training & Development Stipend Bloomfield is an equal opportunity employer. We consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status, or other protected classes.

title: Senior Product Designer
description: Were looking for a full-time product designer, with deep expertise within mobile/app development for an energy consumer service in Sweden used by 200 000+ households. The service is like fitbit but for your energy home and also allows you to fully control all the devices inside your home such as your EV, Solar Panels, Heat Pump and more. Were looking for a true problem solver that is highly communicative and loves to collaborate. Were not searching for a person solely looking to design on their own.

title: Sr. Product Designer
description: About us:Founded in May 2013 and headquartered in California, UI8 stands at the forefront of digital design innovation. As a premier web-based platform, we offer an extensive array of UI design assets, including bundles, UI kits, wireframe kits, themes, icons, and fonts. Beyond being a dynamic marketplace, UI8 is also committed to providing custom design and development solutions tailored to the unique needs of startups and companies globally. Our expertise and dedication to quality have made us a go-to resource for businesses seeking to boost their digital presenceRole Overview:We are seeking a creative and experienced Senior Product Designer under a contract position to join our team at UI8. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in visual design and a proven track record of building and shipping digital products. This role is pivotal in shaping the design of our innovative product offerings, particularly in the realms of eCommerce, cryptocurrency, and AI. Key Responsibilities: Design and develop high-quality user interfaces and visual elements for digital products. Create and maintain comprehensive design systems (in Figma) to ensure consistency and efficiency across products. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure design aligns with business objectives and user needs. Stay abreast of the latest trends and technologies in design, eCommerce, crypto, and AI sectors. Lead design projects from ideation to completion, ensuring timely delivery without compromising on quality. Required Experience and Skills: 3-4 years of experience in designing and shipping digital products. Strong visual design background with a portfolio showcasing your work. High proficiency in creating, implementing, and maintaining design systems. Extensive experience in designing applications for eCommerce, Crypto, and AI-related products. Excellent communication and teamwork skills. Benefits: Opportunity to work in a dynamic, innovative, and supportive environment. Competitive salary and growth opportunities. Salary range: $80,000 - 120,000 / yr. (Based on experience / skill) + yearly bonuses based on performance.

title: A Designer Thats Work Shows They Care
description: What We Are Looking For:We are looking for a designer, artist, and creative that DEEPLY CARES about creating magical products. We are looking for someone who wants to create a brand and experience that they view as a masterpiece they are proud of for decades to come.30,000 Foot View On Air:At Air, we are obsessed with creating magical products that will make our future grandkids proud and that cause our customer’s faces to light up. We are currently working on a suite of products that help businesses scale rapidly… from a fintech platform that facilitates high ticket purchases, to a conversational AI that can have full-blown 25 minute sales calls and is indistinguishable from a human. Because of our customers love for our products, we’ve generated $4.21MM in revenue since launching Air 29 days ago ($52MM/yr pace w/o a dime of VC capital).Comp:Salary: $120k-$250k a yearOwnership: 0-1% equityThe Most Important Question: Why Air?You are on a floating rock in the middle of the universe. Let that sink in.The truth is… you do not need another “job.” — if that is what you are looking for, you can save your time and just stop reading now.What you need is to be a part of something that matters — to be a part of something that causes you to tap dance into work everyday.At Air, we are obsessed with creating magical products that will make our future grandkids proud and that cause our customer’s faces to light up.After all, that is the real goal of building software… not to generate ARR, not to prop up your valuation, not to raise more capital… but to create products you are proud to stamp your name on and to create products that are a part of your life story.And the fascinating dichotomy that our team at Air believes in strongly is that a team obsessed with creating great products always has more success than a team focused primarily on making money.At Air, our focus on product is why we have generated $4.21MM in revenue since launching 29 days ago ($52MM/yr pace w/o a dime of VC capital).We aren’t building Air to sell in the next few years or to add some zero’s to our net worth. We want to build a company that lives long past any of our founders. A company that maintains an essence of excellence over the long term. A company that people can feel is synonymous with quality.We are looking for more A players to join our team that meet these 3 criteria:1. Someone Willing To Work Obsessively On Something They Truly Believe In (An Obsessive... They Think About “Air” All The Time)2. Someone With Years Of Evidence Of Exceptional Ability At Their Craft (And Learns Rapidly)3.
